attributes.action: Introduce owner-funded dog DNA register so that Councils can fine owners easier.
attributes.background: Dog fouling is the blight of Britain.Whilst Councils have powers to enforce legislation most don't have the manpower to do this away from town centres. A DNA register would allow a much more efficient prosecution process. People have the right to walk without looking at their feet.
attributes.additional_details: DNA registration is relatively cheap, and economies of scale with a national database would reduce the costs further. This cost would be the responsibility of the owner, and a legal requirement to have a dog DNA registered. Due to the amount of dog fouling, especially on open public spaces away from Wardens/Police, there is very little chance of anyone being fined for letting their dog foul, or picking it up but throwing their dog bag into the hedge.

attributes.action: Build Nuclear Bunkers sufficient for the population accounting for growth.
attributes.background: There is and always has been since creation a threat of nuclear attack, currently as individuals there is effectively nothing we can to protect ourselves from an attack for example from North Korea, in the event of nuclear attack millions of people would be helplessly destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: I would ask that the government ensure the construction regardless of the financial cost of nuclear shelters in major urban population centres for all persons of the area and accounting for influx of peoples to the shelters from outside of the area and population growth so that people can protect themselves from a nuclear attack, I would ask people be quickly and indiscriminately accepted into these shelters and essentials be available for prolonged life from within the shelter.

attributes.action: Ban all stand alone ATM’s
attributes.background: Everyday the news and social media are reporting on the increasing crime of Ram Raids on shops for the stand alone cash machines (ATM). Some of these shops have been targeted more than once. This has to stop, and the only way we can help, is to have the stand alone machines removed from shops now.
attributes.additional_details: The Police can only advise shopkeepers on security and not enforce it, and the stand alone ATM’s do not have trackers fitted or ‘Smart’ Water. I am asking for these cash machines to be removed from shops, and the initial temptation for these criminals will also be removed. Livelihoods, jobs, are all disrupted. Bank / Post office branch cash machines are better installed and are rarely raided, we live in a world where we pay for things via apps, so cash is not that essential.

attributes.action: End institutional care for children: orphanages and children's homes
attributes.background: Over 55% of those in the care system end up in the prison system, are vulnerable for human trafficking, prostitution, drugs, alcohol abuse and teenage pregnancy, plus, 40% of care leavers are not in education, employment or training at age 19 compared to 11% of the general population.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of children in care live in Foster Homes costing the Country £1.5 Billion, however, 25% of children in care who live in Children's Homes costs the Country £1 Billion (2012-2013) on average £133,000 - £148,000 per child per year, yet it will cost a parent approximately £25,000 - £30,000 per year to send their child to a top boarding school to receive the best education money can buy, and those that attend boarding school don’t end up in prison. This is one of many viable solutions to consider

attributes.action: Fund higher-level classes for profoundly gifted GCSE students
attributes.background: Many highly intelligent pupils feel abandoned by their secondary schools in the UK. Their ability to work and absorb new information at faster rate results in the majority of their time in school being unproductive, wasting time that should be spent realising their potential in academia.

attributes.action: Armed Forces Veterans should be entitled to concessionary rail travel.
attributes.background: Should have the same entitlement to discounted rail travel as serving members.
attributes.additional_details: As a Royal Navy veteran (23 years under the waves) I feel it unfair that there is no mechanism in place to obtain a railcard other than the normal route, ie Family & Friends, Disability, 16-25 or wait until I reach 60. Serving our country is an honour and requires a massive commitment for many years, so I do not feel it is too much to ask for a small token to help with travel costs, especially when none of the other cards are valid for the lone, uninjured, pre-State Pension Veteran traveller.

attributes.action: Adopt a stance of permanent military neutrality, as a nation state.
attributes.background: Military intervention has been largely unpopular and entirely ineffective at ending the issues it claims plague the world. Conquest is forbidden as a peremptory norm, aggression is mostly too. Self defense implies neutrality, saving 1-1.5% of GDP each year to spend on other sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the time of the Peace of Westphalia, the military has lost two of its three purposes. Internal revolt and crime being dealt with by local police forces, the right of conquest being outlawed per jus cogens, only self defense remains. Neutrality is a natural and rational position when self defense is the only legal use of arms. 

Largely, neutral countries such as Switzerland, Austria, Ireland, Finland spend 0.5-1% of GDP on their militaries. That equates to £20-30bn in savings per year.

attributes.action: Create a ‘Residential Care Voucher’ scheme
attributes.background: As a parent to a young child, I can take advantage of the tax-efficient way to pay towards her childcare. I propose a similar scheme be set up so that people can save towards the often unmanageable costs surrounding residential care for elderly loved ones.
attributes.additional_details:
A scheme should exist where:
Employees can pay into a ‘pot’ that is dedicated to the residential / end-of-life care of loved ones.
Monies saved are protected by a government-backed scheme (similar to savings at the bank)
Savings to the employee are present through salary-sacrifice
Monies deposited  are available should they become not necessary
People can chose to pay into their own account and/or an account for a relative/friend 

The scheme should mirror the current childcare voucher scheme

attributes.action: Amend the National Lottery licence to specify the Operator should be a Charity.
attributes.background:
The UK National Lottery operator Camelot is a profit making Ltd Company which pays large dividends to Shareholders. It is NOT a registered Charity with the Charity Commission.
A requirement of the Licence should be that the operator be a registered not-for-profit Charity. The Government must act.
attributes.additional_details:
Camelot is NOT a Charity and is NOT registered with the Charity Commission. It should be a not-for-profit organisation.
Camelot's majority shareholder is a Parent Company called Premier Lotteries UK Ltd, which in turn is majority owned by a Canadian Teachers Pension Fund, specifically Ontario.
The last 2 year's dividends paid to this Canadian Pension fund (via Premier Lotteries UK Ltd) were £66.6m in 2017 and £84.2m in 2016. These are funds which could be utilised within the UK on good causes.

attributes.action: Reduce the tax on cigarettes and return cigarettes to old packaging
attributes.background: I don't think I need to explain the price hikes that have gone on in recent years on cigarettes, but the announcement of Phillip Hammond wanting to Raise prices again is a step to far, I suggest in this petition to remove all pre tax on cigarettes so they are just the 20% sales tax as standard
attributes.additional_details: Akin to this is the packaging rule which has caused problems throughout UK supermarkets of tellers handing customers wrong brands then refusing exchanges, is there any evidence that this reduces smoking in youth? Because I have seen no difference

attributes.action: Establish an independent board that investigates complaints against the Police
attributes.background: After our own personal experiences of accessing the Police Complaints System we soon realised it is not fit for purpose.  We  represent a large number of victims  and all of those who have made a complaint to the Police have either not had their complaint investigated or had a satisfactory outcome.
attributes.additional_details: Presently the Police investigate themselves and this is obvious it is open to misconduct.  We and our victims we represent have complained to the IPCC on numerous occasions and they will not investigate the Police often sending the complaint straight back to the Professional Standards Department.  We want a Police Complaints system totally independent to the Police made up of members trained in Law and with civilian oversight and a number of victims of crime on the panel.

attributes.action: Increase the Penalty for NOT STOPPING after an Accident on the Highway by Driver
attributes.background: There are far too many Drivers these days who HIT and RUN, at this time the Penalty is far too Low and needs a Large increase, many are Killed and it is Gutless Not to stop, I know some of these may have a reason like No Insurance or wanted by the Police, they are Cowards when the persons are dying
attributes.additional_details:
In the Media there are cases every week now, this needs Controlling with adverts detailing the Penalty increase, it is a shame where things are going these days making life Cheap.

Let’s try and get things Changed.

attributes.action: Pressure the Iraqi government to acknowledge the Kurdish referendum result.
attributes.background: On the 25th September Kurdistan (a region of Iraq) held a referendum on becoming an independent nation and autonomous state. After years of persecution, the Kurds voted for independence. Yet the Iraqi government fail to recognise the result and use troops to suppress the call for independence.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for coaches to transport children with inadequate seatbelts
attributes.background: In 2016 4% of road deaths were children (a). The law states very clearly that "you can be fined up to £500 if a child isn’t in the correct seat while you’re driving" (b).  Yet currently minibuses and coaches are exempt; "the law does not require passengers under 14 years old to wear a seat belt" (c)
attributes.additional_details:
(a) https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/648081/rrcgb2016-01.pdf

(b) https://www.gov.uk/seat-belts-law 

(c) http://www.childcarseats.org.uk/the-law/other-vehicles-buses-coaches-and-minibuses/

attributes.action: Repeal Restriction of Offensive Weapons Act 1959 amended 1961
attributes.background:
The Restriction of Offensive Weapons Act 1959 (amended in 1961) banned the importation, manufacture, sale, hiring, lending
of knives that are not manually opened by hand, and not locked
in place by hand.

Should the mechanism of a knife should determine it's legality? I don't believe it should.
attributes.additional_details:
Please don't take my word for it, read the sources yourself and please consider another perspective apart from your own. We all benefit from talking

Restriction of Offensive Weapons Act 1959:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Eliz2/7-8/37

Restriction of Offensive Weapons Act 1961 Amendment:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Eliz2/9-10/22

"The Toy That Kills" article that started mass hysteria of "flick knives" which are knives that open by the push of a button:
http://bayimg.com/oajmkAagC

attributes.action: Health Insurance schemes MUST include cover for counselling & Hypnotherapy
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people are affected by mental health disorders & urgently need access to affordable therapies. The NHS simply cannot cope & our mental health services are in crisis. Astonishingly, the Health Insurance Industry does not consider 'health' to include mental well being & fails to provide cover.
attributes.additional_details:
Why does the Health Insurance Industry provide cover for your body but not for your mind? 

Why can you get cover or claim money back when you see an Acupuncturist/Osteopath/Chiropractor but you can't get the same cover to see a Therapist?

Hypnotherapy is quick & effective treatment for a range of mental health issues, including; anxiety, depression, fears, phobias & addictions - ultimately helping reduce the burden on the NHS. So why is Hypnotherapy not covered under health insurance schemes?

attributes.action: Abolish the 60% stealth income tax
attributes.background: The effective income tax rate for earnings of £100,000 - £123,000 is 60%, as the tax free allowance drops away. So the tax rate goes from 40% for earnings under £100,000, up to 60%, and then back down to 40% for earnings between £123,000 and £150,000. Truly bizzare.
attributes.additional_details: This tax rate is a clear disincentive for those earning around £100,000 (mainly those seen as "wealth creators"). So much so that the vast majority will surely act to avoid this rate (e.g. By paying into their pensions). This is dragging liquidity away from the market and therefore adversely affecting everyone in the country.

attributes.action: Create a Government of Shared Unity
attributes.background: Whereby the position of Prime minister is replaced by a parliamentary body consisting of representatives from each party which gained a significant number of votes in the election.
attributes.additional_details: Democracy voted that not one single party should lead Government. To solve issues, and to conclude  Brexit well, Great Britain needs a group of people standing for the best principles from major parties. The needs of Great Britain are large and complex, and can not be resolved by the ideas of one single party. We do not need a dictator; we need a group of passionate people who want to resolve the problems of Great Britain from every aspect-the environment; financially; socially... the list goes on.

attributes.action: Begin review of road traffic offences and sentencing announced in May 2014.
attributes.background: An 'urgent review' into cycling offences will not make the roads safer. It's time for the government to stop chasing  headlines and immediately move forward with the comprehensive review of all road trafiic offences and sentencing that they announced in May 2014.
attributes.additional_details:
The government has an announced an 'urgent review' into cycling offences after the death of Kim Briggs. This was a tragic but very unusual case. Of the 400 or so pedestrians killed a year in the UK, on average two are struck by cyclists. Focusing on cyclists alone will not make the roads safer. The government announced a comprehensive review of all road trafiic offences and sentencing in May 2014. It's time for it to start.

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/charlie-alliston-cyclist-jailed-run-over-cars-vehicles-dangerous-deaths-a7959626.html

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/bike-blog/2017/sep/21/a-new-cycling-law-wont-make-roads-safer-and-could-postpone-laws-that-could

attributes.action: Give all UK residents the right to vote in local government elections
attributes.background: There should be a change in electoral law to ensure that everyone who is permanently resident in the UK and of voting age has the right to vote in local government elections.
attributes.additional_details: For those who live in a local community, numerous aspects of their daily life – such as housing, education, local amenities, public transport, cultural and sports facilities – are influenced by decisions taken by the local authority. It is therefore only fair to extend the right to vote and be elected in local elections to all long-term UK residents, regardless of their citizenship. Such a move would also ensure that EU citizens retain their right to vote in local elections after Brexit.

attributes.action: To make labeling commercial food as vegetarian and/or vegan a legal requirement
attributes.background: Some products on assumption may appear vegetarian/vegan, but when read closely they contain traces of animal produce. It seems reasonable to impose this requirement on the grounds that collectively speaking,it is incredibly time consuming not to mention unpractical for those who require visual aid.

attributes.action: Make a guarantee for no physical checks at NI side of border nor between GB & NI
attributes.background: The departure from the EU Customs Union means bilateral customs checks between ROI and UK, UK has promised unilaterally no physical border checks from its side between NI and ROI and NI and GB, this promise should be made into a legal guarantee as part of the so called "Great Repeal Bill".
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/uk-northern-ireland-border-brexit-eu-hard-no-deal-cabinet-irish-a8235096.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/irish-hard-border-soft-brexit-technology-theresa-may-a8242461.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-43277181

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/02/09/uk-must-set-stone-commitment-no-hard-irish-border-brexit-talks/

https://news.sky.com/story/government-wants-no-changes-to-irish-border-arrangements-10991079

attributes.action: Reinstate Part 2 of the Leveson Inquiry
attributes.background: The Government has cancelled the second part of the Leveson Inquiry into the scale of potentially unlawful behaviour by the Press and Police during the phone hacking scandal.
attributes.additional_details: The public deserves to know of any collaboration involved and any identified offenders should be brought to justice.

attributes.action: Make two modest but sensible precautions in case Brexit goes badly.
attributes.background:
Precaution 1.  Hold a post-Brexit referendum on whether to return to the EU.  

Precaution 2.  Ensure our Brexit Terms include the right for a "fast-track" return of the UK to the EU, ideally under pre-Brexit conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
If that new shirt doesn’t quite fit, we can return it to the shop.  To make sure we don’t lose those precious family photos, we back-up the laptop from time to time. 

So if rights-of-return and back-up plans make sense for an individual, shouldn't a nation of 65 million people have a contingency plan just in case Brexit is not the resounding success we all hope for?

No-one on either side of the argument has a crystal ball, so can we afford not to have an insurance policy in our back pocket?

attributes.action: Car Tax to start from the day you Tax your car and end the day you sell.
attributes.background: If someone buys a car from me mid month and they part exchange their old car they are losing out twice. This is because the new car tax is back dated to the beginning of the month, and the old car can only claim every complete month remaining!

attributes.action: Ban credit cards being used for gambling.
attributes.background: Gambling effects many people,  causes anxiety, depression and can lead to suicide. By banning using credit cards for gambling it ensures anyone who is gambling has the money to do so.

attributes.action: Amend the Dog Act to include taking DNA of every dog to be kept with Microchip.
attributes.background: This was first suggested in July 2016 following a mixed breed Staffie mixed type dog nearly killing my Border Terrier. Only 66 people at that time signed it, so this time round it should get a better result.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the high number of dog attacks on sheep, and people as well as other canines, the aim is to have all dog owners and dog homes must have every dog’s DNA taken and registered on a database with their microchip. This would allow all dogs to be screened when attacks happen to find the owners.  Wounds can be swabbed and detection made, not only during injury investigation or th of sheep, but also for banned breeds!  
The DNA could also assist District Council to check samples of uncollected poo in order to trace owners and prosecute them.

attributes.action: Police officers should be allowed spit hoods as part of their kit.
attributes.background: At the moment police officers can only use a spit hood in the custody footprint ie in the yard, cage or in custody. Imagine having to do a hospital guard for 8 hours with someone spitting at you and constantly threatening to spit at you.
attributes.additional_details: There are significant health risks through spitting a Ukrainian police officer contracted tuberculosis in 2016 and died. You are also at risk of hep b and hep c as well as cold and flu viruses.

attributes.action: Minimum sentences for using physical violence or brandishing weapons.
attributes.background: On a regular basis my colleagues and I are subjected to physical aggression and attacked in the course of our lawful duty. We want minimum custodial sentences brought in so when we are attacked in our workplace or have weapons brandished against us we will have confidence in the justice system.
attributes.additional_details:
On 3 seperate occasions I personally have had knives pulled on me during the execution of warrants issued by HMCTS. On 2 occasions the police refused to arrest as they said there is no point and on the 1 occasion they did the offended was issued a £50.00 fine (which they never paid) with no other punishment at all. 

This is a story that is all too common in our workplace and I feel a minimum sentence should be introduced to provide justice to all frontline workers attacked or threatened.

attributes.action: Enforce the same rules for reclaimed stone as scrap metal, reducing theft.
attributes.background: There is a significant increase in the theft of stone, particularly wall copings (tops) and flags. These are taken and sold to reclaimed yards.  Law should be introduced the same as for scrap metal, ensuring people selling to identify themselves and payments are made to bank accounts only. No Cash

attributes.action: Make the National Speed Limit 80mph.
attributes.background: The motor way is used by drivers to get to further destinations quickly. Having a speed limit is already limiting its use and having an abundance of speed cameras is further limiting it. Making the NSL 80mph will at least contribute to a quicker journey time amongst all these other limitations.
attributes.additional_details:
More car accidents are had on regular roads.
Speed cameras are on many roads where crashes aren't even a problem. 
Amongst restricted parking, restricted roads and roads being flooded with traffic lights, traffic is a problem. Speed cameras further increase this as people slow down just for these cameras.

attributes.action: Naturalisation fees should be reduced significantly, especially for refugees.
attributes.background: Paying fees for Naturalisation or Citizenship, became a nightmare for all people and especially refugees. Family of 5 people have to pay around £6000 to 7000.

attributes.action: All new build homes built in the last 5 years to be granted freehold interest.
attributes.background: Adverse publicity of developers including unreasonable clauses within leases on new houses has led to government consultation.  Developers should not hold power over new home buyers upon legal completion of the house.  People who buy a new build house want to be freeholders not tenants!

attributes.action: Require verified ID for anyone wishing to incorporate a Limited Company.
attributes.background: My business has recently been affected by fraud and the fraudster in question has previously been convicted of and imprisoned for such offences. By using a false name, anyone can easily escape their responsibilities and continue to incorporate new companies to continue to defrauding the public.
attributes.additional_details: By using a false name, fraudsters can easily escape their responsibilities and continue to incorporate new companies to continue to defrauding the public. By introducing ID checks on new company directors, fraud levels could be reduced.

attributes.action: Increase maternity SMP (33 weeks) to match national minimum wage
attributes.background: UK is ranked one of the lowest when it comes to decent maternity pay. SMP is below minimum wage, why? With all the things we are doing for equality and empowerment of women, maternity pay is being ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the financial strain more women are not returning back to work or they are returning back to work earlier than they need to and miss out on bonding with their new born. This causes us to lose skilled women at the workplace and not giving importance to an upbringing of a child.

Is it fair that SMP is below minimum wage? Why is it not being matched? 

There are so many benefits that a change to this can bring, families will be in a better financial situation and more likely to return work.

attributes.action: Incentivise NHS staff retention by writing off student debt for employees.
attributes.background: NHS staff retention is at an all time low in the current economic climate. A large portion of freshly graduated students are looking for jobs oversees due to a lack of incentive to remain in the NHS and the country. To combat this, we propose eliminating student debt for long term NHS employees.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is for a point based system based on time served. This would mean people would give greater consideration to stay with the NHS for a longer period of time. In return, they would be given a larger reduction in debt in accordance with their time spent in the public services.
In the event of leaving the service, the remaining balance would then be calculated by deducting the  value of time served.  A proposal of 10 -15 years service would see all debt removed.

attributes.action: Make time to debate and vote on Jim McMahon's 'Votes at 16' bill in the Commons.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to make time for the House of Commons to debate and vote on Jim McMahon MP's 'Votes at 16' bill.
attributes.additional_details:
Earlier this month Jim McMahon, the Member of Parliament for Oldham West and Royton, introduced a bill to lower the Voting Age to 16. MPs who didn’t support the Bill exploited an old House of Commons rule that means that Bills that are still being debated on a Friday afternoon at 2:30pm aren’t automatically voted on. This makes it very hard for them to become law. This is not just undemocratic, this is indefensible!

http://metro.co.uk/2017/11/03/tory-mps-accused-of-filibustering-to-block-bill-lowering-the-voting-age-to-16-7052134/
https://www.parliament.uk/biographies/commons/jim-mcmahon/4569
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-41862264

attributes.action: Invest in gridscale battery storage to stabilise wholesale prices of electricity
attributes.background: Renewable energy supply has succeeded in droping wholesale MW prices into negative but without storage nothing is being done to prevent low supply periods seeing prices hikes as high as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. A stable grid, means cheaper bills for consumers and a future for energy suppliers
attributes.additional_details: On 11th June 2017 a record 70% of the electricity for the UK’s homes and businesses was low-carbon. Solar cuts the power demand for National Grid, reducing prices, while wind power also lowers prices. When renewable supply drops however wholesale prices are being ramped higher. Prices can fluctuate between less than £0 and as much as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. Battery storage facilities like the new plant seen in South East Australia would resolve this problem and save the consumer money.

attributes.action: Amend the new SDLT rules to include new & existing shared ownership home owners
attributes.background: The new SDLT rules announced in the budget allows first time buyers to avoid stamp duty for properties up to £300k. Shared ownership home owners are not due to pay stamp duty until they staircase to above 80% ownership however they are still liable to pay despite it being their first purchase.
attributes.additional_details: Shared ownership home owners can defer the stamp duty payment until over 80% of a property is owned.  Shared ownership is a scheme used by many young adults to try and get onto the property ladder as a first time buyer. Stamp duty should not be payable for those who are shared ownership home owners on their purchase including when they staircase so are in a position where is needs to be paid for the first time. The new rules need to be amended to cover people in this situation.

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Homes under £300000 for all buyers
attributes.background: Why only abolish stamp duty on houses under £300000 for first time buyers as a lot of families moving home would benefit from this too. Most first time buyers won’t benefit as much as families upsizing their house and the saving would incentify buying

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on switching the British election system over to MMP
attributes.background: The British FPTP election system has lead to an unproportional Parliament not representing the wants of the British people with parties being able to get a majority with just 30 precent of the vote.
attributes.additional_details:
The British people have never voted on a truly proportional voting system with AV being heavily flawed and with the referendum in question having a turn out of just 40% many voters wanted something else. MMP keeps constituencies and thus the constituent link.
Source:https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mixed-member_proportional_representation

attributes.action: Ban spice!
attributes.background: Local towns and cities are getting worse with what we call the zombie plague i.e. legal high SPICE. Businesses are losing out due to people being too scared of this epidemic, less and less people want to go into their local city or local Town! Something needs to be done about this all over the UK.

attributes.action: Teach the law of the UK and our Human Rights mandatory in the curriculum.
attributes.background: I am currently a student at a High School in the UK. I find it shocking that we learn complicated mathematics, most of which would only be useful in careers specializing in it, the history of the world, yet we don't know our human rights and the laws of the country we live in.
attributes.additional_details: There are people being denied their human rights in this great nation of ours, without knowing it. People are being arrested for crimes they didn't even know existed. Why are students being taught about life in Weimar Germany but not the laws of modern-day UK?

attributes.action: Change how pets are seen in law to ensure police/CPS can prosecute
attributes.background: When clear intent is shown to deprive a family or persons of their pet the police should have the framework in place to ensure the CPS can make an informed decision on prosecution, the Theft Act 1968 doesn't outline what is seen as acceptable steps to reunite an owner with their pet.
attributes.additional_details:
We've seen a sharp rise in pet thefts and millions of Britons will agree, pets are more than just property, they are family. 

We the undersigned request that this government takes further steps to protect animals and owners by clearly outlining:

1) What is seen as acceptable steps to reunite owners with their pets. 

We strongly urge the requirement for chips to be checked as soon as an animal is discovered. This step will allow the police to have a clear view of what is seen as acceptable so "intent to deprive" can be formed. 

2) Reconsider the use the term of "property" for pets. 

Legislation regarding animal welfare shows that we do see them as more than possessions.

attributes.action: Include software digital downloads in the Consumer Contracts Regulations (CCR's)
attributes.background: Software digital downloads are exempt from the CCR's. There's a trend developing where developers are producing software which doesn't do as claimed. Customers pay for downloads in advance and cannot get a refund if the software turns out not to be as described. Devs should also release demos first.
attributes.additional_details: This refers to PS4 and XBox digital download stores. Copying software (piracy) was once a problem but with subscriptions to gaming networks and digital signatures this is no longer possible, nor is it possible to use the games without these subscriptions. Some developers are now taking to "hyping" their games to promote pre-orders - to take money first and worry about problems later and there is nothing to stop the developer abandoning game support after sale. The CCR's are being exploited.

attributes.action: Make the purchase of fireworks without a permit & I.D illegal.
attributes.background: The number of emergency calls received by police relating to fireworks & their misuse could be reduced if retailers recorded who they sell to & require the buyer to present a firework permit issued in a similar way that a person may apply for a private event permit meaning less antisocial behaviour
attributes.additional_details:
If you have ever called the police because fireworks are being used in dangerous ways you may have been told its not a priority despite a firework being able to cause major injuries, with a permit and ID required to purchase fireworks less youths will be able to purchase fireworks, to reinforce this 
All retailers should record the details of who bought the fireworks, when, how many of which type. In doing so it will be easy to identify law abiding retailers by checking sales records and stock

attributes.action: Allow Ex-Servicemen to cash in their service pensions.
attributes.background: This would give Ex-Servicement the same rights with their pension pots as similar civilian pension holders.
attributes.additional_details: This would allow the Ex-Servicemen to either buy, upscale or simply reduce their mortgages, thus providing living security. It would also provide the Ex-Servicemen with the exact same options with their pension pots as their civilian counterparts.

attributes.action: Make voting in local & general elections compulsory.
attributes.background: The 'turn-out' at local government elections is abysmal. The resultant problem is that small groups that are motivated by a covert agenda may succeed. A 'fixed penalty' for failing to vote - as applies in Australia & N.Z. - might provide an extra incentive to vote.
attributes.additional_details: District & County Councillors, School Governors, are being elected by a tiny number of electors. Called upon to administer complex issues & substantial budgets, they may be - at best - incompetent, at worst be driven by a motive contrary to that desired by the majority. The ballot slip should include a box labelled 'none of the above', but anyone on the electoral roll who doesn't vote should have to pay a fixed penalty - say £50. Voting 'on line' should also be possible.

attributes.action: Make road cycling safer by introducing a law to enforce reflective clothing.
attributes.background: I am a cyclist and a motorist, but i feel strongly that too many cyclists are not aware that they are not visible in dark clothing. By introducing a law, we can help cut down road traffic accidents involving cyclists and improve their general safety.
attributes.additional_details: My partner and I are members of Catford Cycling Club - which is one of the oldest in the U.K. We have been cycling many years. I regularly have to make cyclists aware that they are not visible on the road.

attributes.action: Debate the United Kingdom's recognition of Kosovo as an Independent Country.
attributes.background: I believe Kosovo was wrongly recognised as an independent country by the United Kingdom. The bombing campaign conducted by NATO in 1999 and Kosovo's separation in 2008, were unjust acts upon Serbia. This should be debated in Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom wrongly recognised Kosovo's unilateral declaration of independence a day after it was declared on the 17th of February 2008. The unjust settlement was introduced without the agreement of both parties and a binding Security Council resolution. Serbia’s sovereignty was thus undermined and disrespected in the process. Therefore, the declaration of independence by Kosovo can be argued to be an unlawful secession and needs to be debated in parliament once more.
